Quanto valem as suas fortunas? |url=https://jornaleconomico.sapo.pt/noticias/pique-e-shakira-vao-divorciar-se-quanto-valem-as-suas-fortunas-900952/ |access-date=13 June 2025 |newspaper=[[:pt:Jornal Económico|Jornal Económico]] |language=pt-PT}}</ref> and ''Monitor do Mercado''.<ref>{{cite web |last=Vitor |date=1 March 2025 |title=Conheça os segredos de Shakira, a rainha da música latina |url=https://monitordomercado.com.br/noticias/222188-conheca-os-segredos-de-shakira-a-rainha-da-musica-latina/ |access-date=13 June 2025 |website=Monitor do Mercado |language=pt-BR}}</ref>|group=lower-alpha}} she has had a [[Cultural impact of Shakira|significant impact]] on the musical landscape of [[Latin America]] and has been credited with popularizing [[Hispanophone]] music on a global level. The recipient of [[List of awards and nominations received by Shakira|various accolades]], she has won four [[Grammy Awards]] and fifteen [[Latin Grammy Awards]], including three [[Latin Grammy Award for Song of the Year|Song of the Year]] wins.

Shakira made her recording debut with [[Sony Music|Sony Music Colombia]] at the age of 14. Following the commercial failure of her first two albums, ''[[Magia (Shakira album)|Magia]]'' (1991) and ''[[Peligro (Shakira album)|Peligro]]'' (1993), she rose to prominence with the next two, ''[[Pies Descalzos]]'' (1995) and ''[[Dónde Están los Ladrones?]]'' (1998). Shakira entered the English-language market with her fifth album, ''[[Laundry Service (album)|Laundry Service]]'' (2001), which sold over 15 million copies worldwide, becoming the best-selling album of all time by a female Latin artist. Her success was further solidified with the Spanish-language albums ''[[Fijación Oral, Vol. 1]]'' (2005), ''[[Sale el Sol]]'' (2010), ''[[El Dorado (Shakira album)|El Dorado]]'' (2017), and ''[[Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran]]'' (2024), all of which topped the [[Billboard Top Latin Albums|''Billboard'' Top Latin Albums]] chart, making her the first woman with number-one albums across four different decades. Her English-language albums ''[[Oral Fixation, Vol. 2]]'' (2005), ''[[She Wolf (album)|She Wolf]]'' (2009), and ''[[Shakira (album)|Shakira]]'' (2014) received platinum certifications in various countries worldwide.

Shakira scored numerous number-one singles and other top songs worldwide, including "[[Estoy Aquí]]", "[[Ciega, Sordomuda]]", "[[Ojos Así]]", "[[Whenever, Wherever]]", "[[Underneath Your Clothes]]", "[[Objection (Tango)]]", "[[La Tortura]]", "[[Hips Don't Lie]]", "[[Beautiful Liar]]", "[[She Wolf (Shakira song)|She Wolf]]", "[[Waka Waka (This Time for Africa)]]", "[[Loca (Shakira song)|Loca]]", "[[Rabiosa (song)|Rabiosa]]", "[[Can't Remember to Forget You]]", "[[Dare (La La La)]]", "[[La Bicicleta]]", "[[Chantaje]]", "[[Te Felicito (Shakira and Rauw Alejandro song)|Te Felicito]]", "[[Shakira: Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53|Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53]]", and "[[TQG]]". Shakira served as a coach on two seasons of the American singing competition television series ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]'' (2013–2014), had a voice role in the animated film ''[[Zootopia]]'' (2016), and executive produced and judged the dance competition series ''[[Dancing with Myself (TV series)|Dancing with Myself]]'' (2022). She is credited with opening the doors of the international market for other Latin artists. ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' named her the Top Female Latin Artist of the Decade twice (2000s and 2010s).

With over 95 million records sold worldwide, Shakira is one of the world's [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling musicians]]. She has written or co-written nearly all of the material she recorded or performed, music and lyrics, during her career. Noted to be an "international phenomenon" whose music, story, and legacy "resonate in every corner of the globe", Shakira has been described as an artistic link between the West and the East for popularizing [[Middle East]]ern sounds in the [[Western world|West]], and Western sounds in the East. For her philanthropic and humanitarian work, such as the [[Barefoot Foundation]], and her contributions to music, she received the [[Latin Recording Academy Person of the Year]] and [[Harvard University|Harvard Foundation]] Artist of the Year awards in 2011. Shakira was appointed to the [[White House Initiative on Educational Excellence for Hispanics|President's Advisory Commission on Educational Excellence for Hispanics]] in the United States in 2011, and was granted the honor of ''[[Ordre des Arts et des Lettres|Chevalier of the Order of Arts and Letters]]'' by the French government in 2012. She has been an advocate for the interests of children, the [[Latin Americans|Latino]] minority in the U.S. and Canada, women, and other under-represented groups.
